docs.text:
modular Python packages the cryo-ET community can depend on

The goal of teamtomo is to provide:

  • a place for high quality Python packages that the community can rely on
  • a place for developers to learn and build things together

Why?

Python is a great language for image analysis. We make interacting with and analysing cryo-EM data from Python easier by providing useful packages.

Please take a look at the list of packages for Input/Output and Image Analysis for a description of existing packages.

Key ideas

  • packages are small, modular and easy to install
  • package scope is limited and well defined
  • APIs are Pythonic and type hinted
  • code is tested

If this seems daunting, we're here to help, please reach out by posting on image.sc)!

Development model

Because packages in teamtomo are small and well scoped it is easy to depend on only those packages relevant to your work.

teamtomo is not a place for the development of your own software projects. Your projects belong to you and the credit should be yours alone! Did you develop a small, reusable component along the way that could benefit the entire community? We would love to work with you to bring it here.

Work with us

Interested in working with us in some way? Fantastic, Welcome aboard!

Most discussion should happen on image.sc so it is easy to find when searching online.

For realtime chat we use image.sc's zulip, a chat platform open to all for discussing details about the project.

Looking for the Warp/Dynamo/RELION/M guide? teamtomo.github.io/teamtomo-site-archive

docs.title: Image Analysis Packages
docs.text:
Some of the image processing we do in cryo-EM is domain specific.

These packages for image analysis help you to explore your new ideas without reinventing the wheel. Many are implemented in PyTorch, this means they can run on GPUs and make use of autodiff for parameter optimisation.

  • torch-fourier-slice

    Fourier slice theorem implementation for tomographic projection

  • torch-cubic-spline-grids

    Cubic spline interpolation on regular grids

  • torch-fourier-rescale

    Fast and accurate image rescaling using Fourier methods

  • torch-fourier-shift

    Subpixel image shifting using Fourier transforms

  • torch-subpixel-crop

    Accurate subpixel cropping for image processing

  • torch-image-lerp

    Linear interpolation for images and volumes

  • torch-grid-utils

    Utilities for working with regular grids in PyTorch

  • torch-fourier-shell-correlation

    FSC calculation for resolution estimation

  • torch-so3

    3D rotation operations and utilities

  • torch-tiltxcorr

    Coarse tilt series alignment in PyTorch

  • torch-transform-image

    Real space transformations of 2D/3D images in PyTorch

  • torch-find-peaks

    Find and refine peaks in 2D/3D images using PyTorch

  • torch-affine-utils

    Utilities for affine transforms of 2D/3D coordinates in PyTorch

docs.title: Input / Output Packages
docs.text:
Cryo-EM/ET software often read and write domain specific file formats.

Analysis of cryo-ET data often involves a little scripting, these file input and output packages are there to make that a little easier.

  • starfile

    Read and write relion and other starfiles

  • imodmodel

    Read and write imod model files

  • mdocfile

    Read and write SerialEM metadata files

  • emfile

    Read and write EM image files

  • dynamotable

    Read and write Dynamo table files

  • mmdf

    Read and write macromolecular structure files
